Yes, especially the creator of the mash-up pack had to use a PC to create the mash-up pack by adding custom textures for the pack, and the Super Mario Mash-up Pack trailer from 2024 (from Nintendo) shows that the mash-up pack was running on a PC.

Ignoring the trailer, basically the PC would be used to create the mash-up pack and it's updates for Switch players to get, but the mash-up pack itself is not allowed to be used on the PC, that the mash-up pack is created on.

Deleted spammy comment, cleaned up subject to make it easier to find in searches.
YESSSS

I agree with you very much. As a strong Skyrim fan, I love the aesthetic of the Skyrim mashup and I liked the beginnings of a Skyrim world but it certainly needs fleshing out. Some things I was disappointed with what seemed like some weird texture choices, for example spiders as mudcrabs rather than frostbite spiders, pillagers as dawnguard rather than bandits, sticks as staffs, iron golems as frost trolls (I think they should have been dwarves centurions) and other such things. Also I found that making the Iron bars Look dwarven makes them less universal in their use. I would have also preferred more dwarven looking blocks as the dwarven sandstone blocks just didn’t seem to look dwarven enough to really use. I would be very eager for an update on this mashup to fix some of these problems, make a more complete Skyrim world and perhaps bring it up to the quality of other packs like the fallout and Star Wars packs. I really liked the idea for this pack. It is the main pack I use. It just should be more complete and comprehensive.

I think they wanted to just build whiterun hold, and build the entire city, whereas the fallout map was a squished down version of fallout 2, 3, and 4.
This was all built on the old version, to, so they only had one map space to build on.

If the developers continue working on these textures to update them, in my case I use Fallout textures a lot, they should try to expand these maps a little more and add more characters.and even with these new Mod functions you can also make a Mod of these, as they did with Star Wars Mash up
As well as the barbarian

the only thing is what if it is already on a world would it delete the world or maby corrupt the world and delete the blocks in the world that is part of the pack

 

good idea just this is one thing i am scared about

I like this, but I agree with the first comment, what if you uninstall a pack and there is a world that has that pack? Will the world be deleted or corrupted? Plus, I don't have a problem with too little free space left, my PC is pretty good (not like those crazy gaming computers LOL).

     -BrycenPro15

P.S. (from the poster) any world with packs uninstalled will be in stasis where if reinstall the pack used, the world will stay untouched (this post was more directed off of experience with my Nintendo switch.)

If you delete an addon which is used in a world, block contained in the addon will just be replaced by a block with the texture of dirt and a "?" symbol, if after you redownload the addon, blocks will be replaced but items will disapear so there is no risks of corruption.
